alert.note: Alert for Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE... SOUTHEASTERN MUSSELSHELL...ROSEBUD AND NORTHWESTERN TREASURE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 AM MDT... At 1256 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 17 miles southwest of Melstone, or 25 miles east of Roundup, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...These storms were producing very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall will cause quick water rises on streams and ditches, which could cause minor low land flooding. Also, ponding of water will develop on roadways. These storms will remain over the Bull Mountains and over mainly rural areas of north central Yellowstone, southeastern Musselshell, Rosebud and northwestern Treasure Counties. These storms will not impact Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Rosebud; Treasure
